smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'MainActivity' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Object 'Companion' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside objects is set to '11'

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function addTimetableDay is nested too deeply.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function sendRequest appears to be too complex.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: org.mosad.seil0.projectlaogai.fragments.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UtilityClassWithPublicConstructor
smells.description: The class declaration is unnecessary because it only contains utility functions. An object declaration should be used instead.

instances.message: The class NotRetardedCalendar only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.
The class PreferencesController only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.
The class TCoRAPIController only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.
The class NFCMensaCard only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.
The class Utils only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (currentDay == Calendar.MONDAY && cal.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK) == Calendar.SUNDAY) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: currentDay == Calendar.MONDAY && cal.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK) == Calendar.SUNDAY
Parentheses in (currentTime - mensaMenu.meta.updateTime) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: currentTime - mensaMenu.meta.updateTime

Parentheses in (currentDay == Calendar.MONDAY && cal.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK) == Calendar.SUNDAY) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: currentDay == Calendar.MONDAY && cal.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK) == Calendar.SUNDAY
Parentheses in (currentTime - timetables[0].meta.updateTime) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: currentTime - timetables[0].meta.updateTime
Parentheses in (Gson().fromJson(timetableObject, TimetableCourseWeek().javaClass)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Gson().fromJson(timetableObject, TimetableCourseWeek().javaClass)
Parentheses in (currentRaw.toFloat() / 1000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: currentRaw.toFloat() / 1000
Parentheses in (currentRaw.toFloat() * 0.0000075) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: currentRaw.toFloat() * 0.0000075
Parentheses in (lastRaw.toFloat() / 1000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: lastRaw.toFloat() / 1000
Parentheses in (lastRaw.toFloat() * 0.0000075) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: lastRaw.toFloat() * 0.0000075
Parentheses in (meal.parts.size - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: meal.parts.size - 1
Parentheses in ((b[i + offset].toInt() and 0x000000FF).toLong() shl shift) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (b[i + offset].toInt() and 0x000000FF).toLong() shl shift

smells.name: ForbiddenComment
smells.description: Flags a forbidden comment. Defaults values are TODO:, FIXME: or STOPSHIP:

instances.message: This comment contains text that has been defined as forbidden in detekt.
This comment contains text that has been defined as forbidden in detekt.
This comment contains text that has been defined as forbidden in detekt.

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function createFromParcel has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class DesfireRecord defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: ThrowsCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of throw statements in methods.

instances.message: Too many throw statements in the function sendRequest. The maximum number of allowed throw statements is 2.
